basics.name: Zihan Zhou
basics.summary: Master's Graduate actively seeking PhD opportunities in Machine Learning and Computer Vision. Research focuses on efficient training methods, 3D reconstruction, federated learning, and continual learning.

work.summary: Advisor: Prof. Reza Rawassizadeh. Developing end-to-end camera to 3D human model pipeline using pose estimation, motion reconstruction, and Blender integration. Working on gradient-based early stopping for transformers (GradES paper).
highlights: Co-authored GradES paper achieving 1.57x-7.22x training speedup
Built complete pipeline from 2D video to 3D character animation
Implemented LoRA-C fine-tuning for efficient pose estimation

work.summary: Advisor: Prof. Avi Mohan. Investigating federated learning convergence theory through dual-track research combining practical YOLOv8 object detection with controlled theoretical validation.
highlights: Discovered BatchNorm's critical role in FL convergence (18.6% performance impact)
Built UltraFlwr framework integrating Flower and YOLOv8
Validated convergence theory across heterogeneity levels (Î» from 12 to 2185)

publications.name: GradES: Significantly Faster Training in Transformers with Gradient-Based Early Stopping
publications.summary: Novel gradient-based early stopping method operating at component level within transformers, achieving 1.57x-7.22x training speedup while improving generalization. Co-authors: Qifu Wen, Xi Zeng, Zihan Zhou, Shuaijun Liu, Mehdi Hosseinzadeh, Ningxin Su, Reza Rawassizadeh.

portfolio.name: Continual Learning in Sequential Tasks

portfolio.name: Federated Learning: Theory and Practice
